'Updates your dependencies to the latest version according to composer.json, and updates the composer.lock file.'
'Packages that should be updated, if not provided all packages are.'
'Temporary version constraint to add, e.g. foo/bar:1.0.0 or foo/bar=1.0.0'
'Forces installation from package sources when possible, including VCS information.'
'Forces installation from package dist|source|auto (auto chooses source for dev versions, dist for the rest).'
'Outputs the operations but will not execute anything (implicitly enables --verbose).'
'DEPRECATED: Enables installation of require-dev packages (enabled by default, only present for BC).'
'Overwrites the lock file hash to suppress warning about the lock file being out of date without updating package versions. Package metadata like mirrors and URLs are updated if they changed.'
'Skip the install step after updating the composer.lock file.'
'DEPRECATED: This flag does not exist anymore.'
'Update also dependencies of packages in the argument list, except those which are root requirements.'
'Update also dependencies of packages in the argument list, including those which are root requirements.'
'Shows more details including new commits pulled in when updating packages.'
'Autoload classes from the classmap only. Implicitly enables `--optimize-autoloader`.'
'Use a custom prefix for the APCu autoloader cache. Implicitly enables --apcu-autoloader'
'Ignore a specific platform requirement (php & ext- packages).'
'Interactive interface with autocompletion to select the packages to update.'
'Restricts the update to your first degree dependencies.'
The <info>update</info> command reads the composer.json file from the
current directory, processes it, and updates, removes or installs all the
To limit the update operation to a few packages, you can list the package(s)
you want to update as such:
You may also use an asterisk (*) pattern to limit the update operation to package(s)
To run an update with more restrictive constraints you can use:
To run a partial update with more restrictive constraints you can use the shorthand:
To select packages names interactively with auto-completion use <info>-i</info>.
'<warning>You are using the deprecated option "--dev". It has no effect and will break in Composer 3.</warning>'
'<warning>You are using the deprecated option "--no-suggest". It has no effect and will break in Composer 3.</warning>'
'<warning>Composer is operating significantly slower than normal because you do not have the PHP curl extension enabled.</warning>'
// replace the foo/bar:req by foo/bar in the allowlist
'Only root package requirements can receive temporary constraints and '
// the arguments lock/nothing/mirrors are not package names but trigger a mirror update instead
// they are further mutually exclusive with listing actual package names
'<error>You cannot simultaneously update only a selection of packages and regenerate the lock file metadata.</error>'
'--interactive cannot be used in non-interactive terminals.'
'<info>Press enter without value to end submission</info>'
'Would you like to continue and update the above package%s [<comment>yes</comment>]? '
